content.webTitle: Bankrupt England goalkeeper David James puts memorabilia up for sale

fields.headline: Bankrupt England goalkeeper David James puts memorabilia up for sale
fields.bodyText: The former England goalkeeper David James has put hundreds of items of football memorabilia collected during his career up for auction after being declared bankrupt in May. James, currently player-manager of Kerala Blasters FC in the Indian Super League, is believed to have racked up serious debts despite a career that saw him play for Liverpool, Aston Villa, West Ham, Manchester City and Portsmouth. The London-based auctioneer Hilco are selling 150 signed shirts, shorts and match balls, including James’ shirts from the World Cup finals in South Africa. Also up for grabs is the 44-year-old’s customised Astra van, Raleigh Chopper bikes, a petrol chainsaw and Jubilee plastic mug. Bids for his possessions are being accepted from 6 to 18 November.
